metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8367 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The phase_one_correct function in Libraw before 0.17.1 allows attackers to cause memory errors and possibly execute arbitrary code, related to memory object initialization.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8367` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
libraw9 - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
exactimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libraw package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1').
rawtherapee: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
